item.title: The Weekly OSM is out: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16183

Although OSMF has been employing people and paying some contractors recently, this is still dwarfed by very generous donations of time & effort from volunteer working groups, board, and (of course) our mapping community. Wishing a happy #InternationalVolunteerDay2022 to you all!

Once more for the people in the back - the Engineering Working Group has a new call for proposals up on the blog! Requirements are in French, Spanish, Arabic, Dutch and Swahili. All the details are linked in the post: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/
This is just a few weeks worth . . . üôåüèª https://osmcal.org/
There are SO MANY #OSM events - have you noticed this? You can add yours to the OSM calendar--which, amongst other things means it will appear in the weeklyOSM newsletter https://osmcal.org/
And, you might ask, who is eligible to vote? Visit this page to learn the details: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2022/Election_to_Board#Answers_to_official_questions_and_manifesto

To learn more about the candidates for the OSMF board and their positions, visit this page: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2022/Election_to_Board#Answers_to_official_questions_and_manifesto

OSMF Board Election are coming! Eligible members will be receiving instructions on how to vote to elect 4 new board members via their registered OSMF email on December 3. Voting starts the same day at 16:00 UTC. Details: https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Foundation/AGM2022/Election_to_Board
In case you missed the Weekly OSM, here's the link: https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/16134 Highlights include:

Update: The Engineering Working Group is still looking for proposals for "adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website. " The guidelines are available in French, Spanish, Arabic, Dutch and Swahili. https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1596326624336777219?s=20&t=uZNTShpVTQClqVVlTpDdyQ

RT @openstreetmap@twitter.com Looking for way to contribute to #osm? The Engineering Working Group is looking for proposals for "adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website." Details at the link https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/ üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/openstreetmap/status/1596326624336777219

Looking for way to contribute to #osm? The Engineering Working Group is looking for proposals for "adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website." Details at the link https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/
If you're interested in the EWG call for proposals, the requirements are here: https://github.com/osmfoundation/ewg_bidding/tree/main/projects/ability-to-mute-other-users

Don't forget! The Engineering Working Group has a new call for proposals for: "adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website" Details at the link: (scroll to the bottom to read it in Dutch French Spanish Swahili and Arabic) https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/

In fact, if you go to this page you'll see that the EWG is looking for new members: here's the process and a list of the current members: https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group#Process_for_new_members

While we're on the topic of the EWG's new call for proposals, you might even want to learn more about the Engineering Working Group itself - so here's a link for that, too. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group

If you're interested in submitting a proposal, you should also read the Engineering Working Group‚Äôs Project Funding Proposal Framework for a general overview of the process. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Engineering_Working_Group/Project_Funding_Framework

For more details on the EWG proposal, including requirements and how to apply, please see the EWG Project Funding Repository on Github. (Click on ‚ÄúAbility to mute other users‚Äù under the Projects section) https://github.com/osmfoundation/ewg_bidding

Call for proposals! The Engineering Working Group (EWG) is announcing a call for proposals for the following feature: Adding the ability to mute users on the http://openstreetmap.org website. More details at the link. https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2022/11/18/engineering-working-group-call-for-proposals/

RT @GIScienceHD@twitter.com #30DayMapChallenge Day 14: Hexagons For today's entry, our fantastic world mapper @mrizwan1khan@twitter.com charts the growth in number of buildings in #OSM using ohsomeHeX. Just look at that progress! #Map #Geography #Building #OpenStreetMap üê¶üîó: https://twitter.com/GIScienceHD/status/1592143138449391616
